thread.title_full: Angelina Jolie 'is NOT dating' castmate Jared Leto | Daily Mail Online

author: Cassie Carpenter For Dailymail.Com
title: Angelina Jolie 'is NOT dating' castmate Jared Leto | Daily Mail Online
text: Share 135 shares At the time, Angelina was said to have been 'desperately infatuated' with Colin Farrell, who played her character Olympias' son. It's hard to imagine the globetrotting mother-of-six would even have time for a love life as she's currently in Cambodia with her blended brood. Castmates: Back in 1999, Jolie played mental patient Lisa (M) alongside the 45-year-old heartthrob as draft dodger Toby in James Mangold's Girl, Interrupted When in Rome: Leto - who was once engaged to Cameron Diaz - and the UN humanitarian shared the screen again in 2004 for Oliver Stone's forgettable historical epic Alexander My So-Called match: At the time, Angelina was said to have been 'desperately infatuated' with Colin Farrell (2-R), who played her character Olympias' son (pictured in 2004) '[The separation] was a very difficult time and we are a family, and we will always be a family,' Jolie told BBC News this week. 'We are and forever will be a family and so that is how I am coping. I am coping with finding a way through to make sure that this somehow makes us stronger and closer.' On Saturday, the By the Sea director attended the premiere of her Netflix film First They Killed My Father, which is about human rights activist Loung Ung. 'I am coping': It's hard to imagine the globetrotting mother-of-six would even have time for a love life as she's currently in Cambodia with her blended brood Streaming later this year! On Saturday, the By the Sea director attended the premiere of her Netflix film First They Killed My Father, which is about human rights activist Loung Ung (R) Meanwhile, the Suicide Squad star next plays a replicant in Denis Villeneuve's Blade Runner 2049 - hitting US/UK theaters October 6 - which is a sequel to Ridley Scott's 1982 classic. The Thirty Seconds to Mars frontman's rock band will open for MUSE's 15-date tour, which kicks off May 20 at the Perfect Vodka Amphitheatre in West Palm Beach.
